The "mythemes" package creates a filter that helps create a more distinct
and publication ready type of visualizations. It transforms regular plots into a more crisp, and high contrast plot. It prioritizes readability by decluttering the chart area removing axis ticks and minor grids while strictly enforcing a clear typographic hierarchy with bolded titles, optimized spacing, and bottom-aligned legends. Designed for flexibility, the package allows users to easily adjust the base font family and size to maintain visual consistency across reports and presentations. 

```{r setup,}

#' Custom Theme: Alex Theme
#'
#' A custom ggplot2 theme 
#'
#'
#' @param base_family Character string. The font family to use (default: "Inter Tight").
#' @param base_size Numeric. Base font size (default: 14).
#'
#' @return A ggplot2 theme object.
#' @import ggplot2
#' @export
alex_theme <- function(base_family = "Inter Tight", base_size = 14) {

  ggplot2::theme_minimal(
    base_size = base_size,
    base_family = base_family
  ) +
    ggplot2::theme(
      # --- Grid Lines ---
      panel.grid.minor = ggplot2::element_blank(),
      panel.grid.major = ggplot2::element_line(
        color = "navyblue",
        linewidth = 0.5,
        linetype = "dashed"
      ),

      # --- Axes ---
      axis.ticks = ggplot2::element_blank(),
      axis.text = ggplot2::element_text(
        color = "brown",
        size = ggplot2::rel(0.8)
      ),
      axis.title = ggplot2::element_text(
        face = "bold",
        margin = ggplot2::margin(t = 10, r = 10, b = 10, l = 10)
      ),

      # --- Plot Text ---
      plot.title = ggplot2::element_text(
        face = "bold",
        size = ggplot2::rel(1.2),
        margin = ggplot2::margin(b = 10),
        hjust = 0
      ),
      plot.subtitle = ggplot2::element_text(
        size = ggplot2::rel(0.9),
        margin = ggplot2::margin(b = 15),
        hjust = 0
      ),
      plot.caption = ggplot2::element_text(
        color = "azure4",
        size = ggplot2::rel(0.7),
        margin = ggplot2::margin(t = 15),
        hjust = 1
      ),

      # --- Legend ---
      legend.position = "bottom",
      legend.title = ggplot2::element_text(face = "bold"),
      legend.text = ggplot2::element_text(size = ggplot2::rel(0.8))
    )
}

```
